What is happening to the Verus Mainnet Protocol and when does it happen?

The Verus Mainnet Protocol is upgrading to incorporate new features, including support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators, changes to staking and mining, and updates to the Verus Proof of Power consensus protocol. This upgrade is scheduled to take place at block 1053660.

**MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BY June 14TH, OR YOU MAY NEED TO RESYNCHRONIZE THE BLOCKCHAIN IF YOU ARE RUNNING IN NATIVE MODE.**At block 1053660, the Verus Mainnet Protocol will upgrade to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and a number of new capabilities, as well as a change to the Verus Proof of Power staking and mining hash will go live on the Verus mainnet as well.## The network upgrade will activate the following features:
- Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators- Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded.- Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds.- A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities.- `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale.- Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself, which it used to retain. After revocation now, the recovery identity will have full control over the revoked ID.- Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2## Notable Changes:
- Fix Komodo S4 notary count
- `sendcurrency` does not require coinbase funds to be shielded.# Disclaimer
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What are some of the new features and changes that will be introduced with the Verus Mainnet Protocol upgrade?

Some of the new features and changes include:

* Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators
* Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any unshielded coinbases from the past
* Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds
* A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities
* `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale
* Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself
* Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2

What are the implications of not upgrading to the new Verus Mainnet Protocol by a certain deadline?

If you are running in native mode and do not upgrade to the new Verus Mainnet Protocol by the deadline, you may need to resynchronize the blockchain. This is to ensure that your node is compatible with the new protocol and can continue to function properly.

What is the purpose of the `sendcurrency` API, and how does it improve the functionality of Verus?

The `sendcurrency` API provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities. This allows for more flexibility and precision when transferring funds, making it easier to manage complex transactions and identities.
